result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel Alexander Lowe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Daniel Alexander Lowe is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Daniel Alexander Lowe was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Daniel Alexander Lowe was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

DE's gf, Kaitlin appeared re: WA.  She was advised that the DE missed his July 1st Atty Fee pymt for $50.  Kaitlin stated she called & was advised that she didn't need to make any pymts until the case was settled, but did not know who she spoke with.  Kaitlin was advised that the DE was just set up on this Pymt Plan which was mailed to him in May & any clerk in this office would not advise her to not make pymt on a newly set up Pymt Plan nor was any call docketed.  She was also advised that all pymt calls should be directed to myself & was given a copy of the Pymt Plan Agmt, in which she stated she believed they did receive it.  Kaitlin pd for July & Aug Atty Fee pymts & was advised that the next pymt of $50 is due 9-01-17.  Includes 15CF444, 17CF237.  jaf

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson.ADA:  Matthew L Hartung   DF ATTY: Andrew Martin Nelson DF: Daniel Alexander Lowe appeared. Case called at 9:03. Includes 15CF298, 15CF444. Court reviews files.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 1 in 15CF444, G of Ct. 4 in 15CF444. DE pleads G to amended Ct. 1 misdemeanor battery in 15CF298. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1  in 15CF444 withholding entering the judgment in favor of the DJOC. Crt finds the DE guilty of Ct. 4 in 15CF444 and guilty of amended Ct. 1 to misdemeanor battery in 15CF298 and enters judgments today. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct 2 and 3 in 15CF298 and Ct. 2 and 3 in 15CF444. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:

On 15CF298 Ct. 1  and Ct. 4 on 15CF444, Sentence W/H
2 years probation with conditions:
60 days condition time STAYED.
- Court notes 1 day credit against any ultimate sentence.
- AODA assessment. 
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Regular and random testing, or at agents discretion.
- DE to maintain employment/schooling.
- 40 hours of community service. 
-  DE to attend a vicitim impact panel. 
- Costs of $243.00 on both misdemeanors.
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge of $200 on both misdemeanors.
- Apply bond on file, remaining to be paid during probation.

Bond will be discharged on 15CF298.
Diversion coordinator to provide quarterly updates to the Court. DE to sign up for probation today.  Restitution info due to the Court within 30 days. 
Upon successful completion on probation and DJOC the Court will make DE eligible for expungement. 
Probation review hearing scheduled for September 12, 2016 at 04:30 pm.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing at 09-28-2015 10:30 am

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Tyler K. or Garrison J.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
